error.signature: You have requested more vCPU capacity than your current vCPU limit allows

verdict.summary: EC2 instance launch failed because the account exceeded the vCPU-based instance limit for the region.

dead_ends.action: Try launching instances rapidly in quick succession
dead_ends.why_fails: The limit is a hard cap, not a rate limit; more requests will all fail

dead_ends.action: Use a different instance family without checking its specific limit
dead_ends.why_fails: vCPU limits are per-instance-family; the other family may also be at its limit

workarounds.action: Request a vCPU limit increase via Service Quotas console or API
workarounds.how: aws service-quotas request-service-quota-increase --service-code ec2 --quota-code L-1216C47A --desired-value NEW_LIMIT

workarounds.action: Terminate unused instances or use Auto Scaling to manage capacity
workarounds.how: aws ec2 describe-instances --filters Name=instance-state-name,Values=running to find instances to terminate

leads_to.condition: Instance limit increases may also hit EBS volume limits

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'You have requested more vCPU capacity than your current vCPU' vs 'You have exceeded the maximum volume limit for this account': while both are aws errors in the quota_error category, the former EC2 instance launch failed because the account exceeded the vCPU-based instance  while the latter AWS account has reached the EBS volume limit for the region. Default limit varie.
